name: Memantine hydrochloride

indications.text: memantine hydrochloride n-methyl-d-aspartate ( nmda ) receptor antagonist indicated treatment moderate severe dementia alzheimer 's type . ( 1 )

contraindications.text: may taken without food . ( 2 ) initial dose 5 mg daily . increase dose 5 mg increments maintenance dose 10 mg twice daily . minimum 1 week treatment previous dose observed increasing dose . ( 2 ) severe renal impairment : recommended dose 5 mg twice daily . ( 2 )

adverseReactions: memantine hydrochloride tablets contraindicated patients known hypersensitivity memantine hydrochloride excipients used formulation . ( 4 )
indications_original: Memantine hydrochloride is an N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA) receptor antagonist indicated for the treatment of moderate to severe dementia of the Alzheimer's type. ( 1 )
contraindications_original: May be taken with or without food. ( 2 ) Initial dose is 5 mg once daily. Increase dose in 5 mg increments to a maintenance dose of 10 mg twice daily. A minimum of 1 week of treatment with the previous dose should be observed before increasing the dose. ( 2 ) Severe renal impairment: recommended dose is 5 mg twice daily. ( 2 )
adverseReactions_original: Memantine hydrochloride tablets are contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity to memantine hydrochloride or to any excipients used in the formulation. ( 4 )
